# Data sets


## Source for Markdown Lewis-Short

- Christopher Blackwell's Lewis-Short in Markdown is published on github as a CITE Collection [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Eumaeus/cex_lewis_and_short/refs/heads/master/ls.cex)
- the data block of that collection is available on the web [here](http://shot.holycross.edu/lexica/ls-articles.cex). Each line of the delimited file is a single article from Lewis-Short.


## Data sets in the LexiconMining github repository

ChatGPT's summaries of Lewis-Short:

- the unaltered replies are in the `suarez/lewisshort-extracts` subdirectory [here](https://github.com/neelsmith/LexiconMining.jl/tree/main/suarez/lewisshort-extracts)
- the postprocessed content is in the `summaries` subdirectory [here](https://github.com/neelsmith/LexiconMining.jl/tree/main/summaries)


Tabulae datasets generated from ChatGPT's summaries are in this github repository:

- Tabulae datasets are in `tabulae-datasets` [here](https://github.com/neelsmith/LexiconMining.jl/tree/main/tabulae-datasets/lewis-short)
